TopicTitle: Do you think this rocket can get to duna?

Articles.Content: It's deltaV is 7335 and it is a 5 stage rocket, carrying 3 kermans. I'm using the KW rocketry mod and mechjeb. I'm planning on not returning to kerbin because I really don't need to.

Apparently the image didn't work?

-mod edit: you need the direct link to the image, fixed it for you-
Duna takes 1,700m/s to reach and establish orbit, without aerobraking, from LKO. With 4,500m/s needed to launch and orbit in the first place that's a total requirement of 6,200. You should be fine.

That rocket can go to Eeloo according to the dv you report. Yet if it is particularly badly designed, it may not be even able to lift off launchpad.

Whether you can go to Duna with it or not depends on your skills. Just go and try it.
I've already been to the mun with it, thank you for the answer. I think it I should be able to do it today
In general a ship that can make a Munar orbit-and-return can make a Duna or Eve flyby-and-return or orbit no return.
I agree with Cantab. It takes only a little more to get to Duna orbit compared to Munar orbit, and you can areobreak at duna to save Delta-V.
If you don't mind my asking, why are you not planning on returning?
Future rescue mission? Or maybe advance colonists.

Yep. Accidental colonists, as 60% of my KSP missions.

(while on launchpad)

Dr. Wernher von Kerman "Godspeed, guys, see you later!"

(closing in to Duna)

Jeb: "We might have just enough fuel to try and land there"

Bob: "Aren't we going to return home?"

Jeb: "Who cares anyway?" (engages deorbit burn)

(landed on Duna)

Jeb: "Yaaay!"

Bill: (unpacking a tent and sleeping bag) "Rescue mission will be here only next year, we will need to establish a colony here meanwhile"

Bob: (Trying to make a hoe out of landing leg) "Screw it Jeb, I am not going to be a farmer once again..."
I'm gonna stay because, I'm on sandbox and I want to have kermans on every planet for some reason.
I'd suggest skipping Jool, bad things tend to happen...
That just means you have to do Jool last. So that, even if only for a moment, you can say you've had Kerbals on the surface of every planet.
